verses.verse: They lie down (1 Cor. 8:10) by every altar on clothes (Ex. 22:26) taken in pledge, And drink the wine of the condemned in the house of their god.

“Yet it was I who destroyed the (Gen. 15:16; Num. 21:25; Deut. 2:31; Josh. 10:12) Amorite before them, Whose height was like the (Ezek. 31:3) height of the cedars, And he was as strong as the oaks; Yet I (Is. 5:24; Ezek. 17:9; (Mal. 4:1)) destroyed his fruit above And his roots beneath.
Also it was (Ex. 12:51; Amos 3:1; 9:7) I who brought you up from the land of Egypt, And (Deut. 2:7) led you forty years through the wilderness, To possess the land of the Amorite.
I raised up some of your sons as (Num. 12:6) prophets, And some of your young men as (Num. 6:2, 3; Judg. 13:5) Nazirites. Is it not so, O you children of Israel?” Says the LORD.
“But you gave the Nazirites wine to drink, And commanded the prophets (Is. 30:10; Jer. 11:21; Amos 7:13, 16; Mic. 2:6) saying, ‘Do not prophesy!’
“Behold, (Is. 1:14) I am weighed down by you, As a cart full of sheaves is weighed down.
(Jer. 46:6) Therefore flight shall perish from the swift, The strong shall not strengthen his power, (Ps. 33:16; Jer. 9:23) Nor shall the mighty deliver himself;
He shall not stand who handles the bow, The swift of foot shall not escape, Nor shall he who rides a horse deliver himself.
The most courageous men of might Shall flee naked in that day,” Says the LORD.
Authority of the Prophet’s Message Hear this word that the LORD has spoken against you, O children of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up from the land of Egypt, saying:

“You ((Gen. 18:19; Ex. 19:5, 6; Deut. 7:6; Ps. 147:19)) only have I known of all the families of the earth; (Jer. 14:10; Ezek. 20:36; Dan. 9:12; Matt. 11:22; (Rom. 2:9)) Therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities.”
Can two walk together, unless they are agreed?
Will a lion roar in the forest, when he has no prey? Will a young lion cry out of his den, if he has caught nothing?
Will a bird fall into a snare on the earth, where there is no trap for it? Will a snare spring up from the earth, if it has caught nothing at all?
If a trumpet is blown in a city, will not the people be afraid? (Is. 45:7) If there is calamity in a city, will not the LORD have done it?
